title: Qarniaraq Mud Volcano
content: Qarniaraq, in the north Aqqala, has one of the widest spreading areas among lranâ€™s mud volcanoes. The spreading area of this mud volcano is circular, with a diameter of 600m. This vast circle is concave, and the mud volcano hill is at its center. This hill is round as well, with a diameter of 50m. This mud volcano was extinct at the 2008 visit, and few traces of gas emission were only seen around it, which were not noticeable. The salt deposits are seen all surrounding of this mud volcano.
